title: If my husband owes child support can they come after me for money that he owes?
question: My husband was incarcerated for two years, and now owes almost $10,000 in back child support for two different child support cases. We fill seperate taxes and I refuse to have a joint bank account, when he does taxes it is intercepted and they tag on to his bank accounts as well. Everything is under my maiden name, but I did report my marriage to the social security office.
question_tags: Child support,Bankruptcy,Debt,Nondischargeable debt and child support,Bankruptcy and debt,Finances and child support,Determining child support payments,Child support arrears,Social security
answers: As long as you keep your finances separate from your husband's your earnings should not be subject to your husband's debts which were not incurred during your marriage.
